alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, northwestern Dutchess and southwestern Columbia Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Paltz, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, New Paltz, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hyde Park, Hurley, Highland, Clermont, Red Hook, Tillson, Saugerties South, Port Ewen, Fairview, Lake Katrine, Staatsburg, High Falls, Lloyd, Esopus and Rosendale. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
